alert.note: Alert for Eastern Kiowa County; Western Kiowa County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 12 at 5:46PM MDT until October 14 at 8:00AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT FRIDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, northwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 26 possible. * WHERE...Kiowa County. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until noon MDT Friday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Friday night through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult along east/west oriented roadways, especially for high profile vehicles. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during high winds, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Kiowa County; Western Kiowa County
